passage:
(1) The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 1700s and soon spread to other parts of Europe and North America. This period marked a major turning point in history as people started using machines to make goods instead of making them by hand. Before this time, most people worked at home or in small workshops, but the Industrial Revolution changed where and how people worked. New factories opened in cities, and many people moved from the countryside to find jobs in these factories.

(2) One of the most important inventions of this time was the steam engine. Steam engines used coal to produce power for machines in factories and later for trains and ships. This made it possible to transport goods and people much faster than before. Another key invention was the spinning jenny, which allowed workers to make cloth much more quickly. These and other machines helped businesses produce more goods at lower costs, which meant more people could afford to buy them.

(3) While the Industrial Revolution brought many benefits, it also created problems. Working conditions in early factories were often dangerous and unhealthy. People worked long hours for little pay, and even young children had to work. Cities grew quickly as people moved to find factory jobs, but there wasn't enough housing for everyone. This led to overcrowded and dirty living conditions where diseases spread easily. The air and water also became polluted from factory smoke and waste.

(4) Despite these problems, the Industrial Revolution changed the world forever. It led to new inventions and scientific discoveries that improved people's lives in many ways. Products that were once luxury items became affordable for ordinary people. The revolution also created new types of jobs and opportunities. Today, many countries around the world are still going through their own industrial revolutions, as they build factories and develop their economies.

questions.question: Choose the correct word: 'He eats _____ every morning.'
Select the correct past tense: 'Last week, we _____ the museum.'
Choose the correct article: 'I saw _____ bird in the tree.'
Select the correct preposition: 'This train goes to Oxford _____ Reading.'
Which sentence is grammatically correct?

options.A: She doesn't like apples or she loves oranges.
options.B: She doesn't like apples also she loves oranges.
options.C: She doesn't like apples so she loves oranges.
options.D: She doesn't like apples but she loves oranges.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: 'This problem is _____ than that one.'
Select the correct form of 'to be': 'They _____ students last year.'
Choose the correct possessive adjective: 'Maria is talking to _____ mother.'
Select the correct plural form: 'There are five _____ on the table.'
Which sentence uses the present perfect correctly?
Choose the correct question form: '_____ you like tea?'
Select the correct modal verb: 'You _____ smoke in this building. It's not allowed.'
Choose the correct adverb form: 'She sings _____.'
Select the correct order of adjectives: 'She has a _____ bag.'
Choose the correct future form: 'I _____ my grandmother next weekend.'
Complete the sentence: 'I don't have _____ money.'
Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'I need to _____ my shoes.'
Select the best response to 'How was your weekend?'
Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'Would you like _____ tea?'
Select the best word to complete the sentence: 'My brother _____ soccer every Saturday.'
Choose the correct phrase to ask about time.
Select the incorrect word to complete the sentence: 'I usually _____ dinner at 7:00.'
Choose the correct expression to offer help.
Select the best word to complete the sentence: 'I don't _____ how to swim.'
Choose the correct expression to show agreement.
White _____ is often added to coffee or tea to make it taste sweet.
If you say 'I will _____ do that again,' it means you will not repeat it.
An _____ is something that helps explain an idea.
A _____ is a road in a city or town with houses or buildings on one or both sides.
_____ is a white grain that many people eat with vegetables or meat.
If someone asks 'Do you want _____?' they are offering you something to choose.
You say '_____ me' when you want to apologize to someone.
When you _____ a place, you go away from it.
The time when it is dark and people usually sleep is called _____.
To _____ someone means to go in the same direction behind them.
A very short period of time is called a _____.
A _____ is fifteen minutes, or one fourth of an hour.
When something happens not always but not rarely, it happens _____.
Children go to _____ to learn.
If you want a small amount but not all, you want _____.
According to paragraph 1, when did the Industrial Revolution begin?
Based on paragraph 1, where did many people move during the Industrial Revolution?
According to paragraph 2, what powered the steam engine?
Based on paragraph 2, why could more people afford to buy goods during the Industrial Revolution?

options.B: Because goods were produced at lower costs
options.D: Because they bought goods from factories

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, which of the following was NOT a problem during the Industrial Revolution?
Based on paragraph 3, why did diseases spread easily in industrial cities?

options.B: Because the weather conditions were bad
options.C: Because people worked hard and were tired
options.D: Because cities were overcrowded and dirty

questions.question: According to paragraph 4, what happened to luxury items during the Industrial Revolution?

options.A: They couldn't be transported to ordinary people
options.B: They became more expensive and not affordable
options.C: They became affordable for ordinary people
options.D: They were only sold in big cities

questions.question: What is the main idea of the passage?

options.A: The Industrial Revolution created many problems in cities
options.B: Steam engines were the most important invention in modern history
options.C: The Industrial Revolution changed how and where people worked and lived
options.D: Britain was the most powerful country during the Industrial Revolution

questions.question: According to the passage, where did the Industrial Revolution start?

options.C: In many European countries at the same time

questions.question: Based on the last paragraph, what is happening in many countries today?

options.A: They are experiencing their own industrial revolutions
options.B: They are solving the problems caused by the Industrial Revolution
options.C: They are inventing new steam engines
options.D: They are moving away from using machines
